intro: Tissa pazensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian fern, is a species of fern native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and rocky crevices. Its rhizome is short and thick, supporting the growth of its bipinnate leaves. Tissa pazensis plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to forest biodiversity.
